April 8, 1969
Mr. Donald Quayle
General Consultant
Corporation for Public Broadcasting
555 Madison Avenue
New York, New York 10022
Dear Don:
I have been remiss in not extending thanks
and appreciation for the CPB Radio Advisory
Committee meeting held March 20-21.
As you know, I think the advisory committee
idea is sound---I'm delighted with the makeÂ¬
up of the group-and I believe the initial
discussions were beneficial. The reaction I
have gotten leads to the conclusion that the
radio people are exceptionally pleased with
the actions CPB is taking relating to radio.
I have written President Macy my comments on
the advisory meeting and suggested some matters
that may merit Corporation review and action.
Again, my personal thanks and that of the
Board of Directors of National Educational
Radio for hosting the meeting--including
the two pots of coffee CPB bought for NER
late Firday afternoon!
Cordially,
RAM/cb
Robert A. Mott
Executive Director, NER
